FuncDef: The acl name command creates a user-defined ACL and displays the ACL view. If the user-defined ACL to be created already exists, running this command directly displays the ACL view. The acl name command creates a user-defined ACL and displays the ACL view. If the user-defined ACL to be created already exists, running this command directly displays the ACL view. By default, no user-defined ACL is created.

ParaDef.Info:
Creates a user-defined ACL with a keyword.
-

Creates a user-defined ACL with a name.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The name must start with a letter or digit, and cannot contain only digits.

Creates a user-defined ACL with a number.
The value is an integer ranging from 5000 to 5999.

ExtraInfo: A user-defined ACL defines rules for filtering packets based on contents extracted from a specified offset. To create a user-defined ACL, run the acl command.
